website_summaries.verdict: Trades off some features, like adjustable foot and arm rests, for an extremely lightweight design.
pros: to lift easily into a vehicle
Offers smooth ride at home or on sidewalks
cons: Wheels are smaller than some expect, though it provides a good tradeoff in weight
Hand wheels are uncomfortable for some to grip
Front wheels are a bit wobbly

customer_reviews.title: Packing problem created angst
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very light, but we'll built and study. When I first tried to open the chair I couldn't do it. After inspection the axel bolts threads were overlapped and pulling them apart was going to be difficult and was likely to damage one or both of them. I had to loosen one and then it was possible to separate the wheels and open the chair. This only happened the first time and appears to have been created during packing. Shorter axel bolts would totally eliminate this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Light is right.
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! What a difference, lifting 24 pounds of wheelchair into the trunk of our car, compared to the 43 pound wheelchair that our new Karman LT-980 has replaced. Just watch your fingers when you take it out of the trunk and open it up. If your fingers are in the wrong spot, they can get pinched in a major way. No, it won't take a finger off or cut you, but you will wish you had been warned about this propensity. Other than that caveat, we love it. Also, you may have to tighten up the axle nuts a bit, if the wheels are rubbing on the side of the chair. Jim A.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A.

customer_reviews.title: Liked the look of this wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Liked the look of this wheelchair. Fold down back and ability to get close to table. But the ease of changing the length of legs was hard, even though they provided tool. For me the wheelchair was hard to push with a 200 lb person on board and front wheels seemed to lock up.
customer_reviews.author: ellen m.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: Better than my expectations! Goes through every doorway in my condo; easy for me to use alone; extremely light weight; while sitting in it I can easily remove the foot rests; if footrests would have had the option of being straight out, it would have gotten 5 stars. I have cast on for ankle replacement and leg is straight out--so I use three thick firm pillows on the footrest. Karman should make that slight adjustment. Overall I'm satisfied with the quality and durability of this chair.
customer_reviews.author: SassySunshine

customer_reviews.title: Footrests Will Not Adjust
customer_reviews.text: We like various aspects of the wheelchair but the footrests are too high for my husband who is 5'10''. We could not adjust them on this wheelchair. We had the most difficult time getting just one screw to loosen and then once loosened there was no way the screw channel would move for adjusting. We followed all directions explicitly. Update: I finally took the footrests to Norco and someone loosened the rests free of cost and quickly. Yes, most kind of them! Unfortunately, when set at perfect setting for the feet, the rests hit the wheels and we had to place them in the original position. It is impractical for my husband and discouraging.
customer_reviews.author: Val Lee

customer_reviews.title: This wheelchair makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this chair. Gone are the days when I had to wait for someone to help me get a wheelchair in and out of the car. I can pop this chair on the backseat, go on my way, and lift it out with one hand. The increase in my mobility - go where I want, when I want - is wonderful. I don't know how long this chair will hold up, but I've had it for several months and have taken it on two flights without a problem. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Nulani

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that would make this chair more useful would be hand brakes on the handles
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that would make this chair more useful would be hand brakes on the handles, so I could take my mom down slopes with confidence. Otherwise, it's pretty much perfect. Some reviewers commented that it was too small but for a normally proportioned person, it's ideal. Its compact size makes it useful in the house and outside too.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!!  Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with this wheelchair. Construction is solid. Ride is comfortable. The seat is nicely padded. It folds easily. Note that our rider is lightweight and small (5’0”), so what’s comfy for her might not suit a larger or taller person. I almost knocked off one star in “easy to fold,” only because there is a risk of pinching your fingers when UNfolding. Probably not worth knocking off a star, but be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard K. Skoch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lightweight Wheelchair, Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this wheelchair, is very lightweight and easy to fold up when I need to lift into the trunk of my car. Is very well built and very sturdy. I'am very confident that I will receive many years of use with this wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: John S Buettner

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I got this today and tried it out. It seems like a real sturdy product and appears very nice looking. I did not see any of the other problems some have had, but then I only bought it for occasional use as I use a power chair most of the time. Bought for those times I cannot transport the larger chair and have to visit doctor or go with someone other than transit. I like the black and silver details of the chair as well. If anything changes with the chair over time I will come back and leave another review, but I doubt I will have to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Every pound counts when you have to put this in the back of the car, and this chair is light. The construction is good and it folds up simple. You can adjust the foot rest height easily if you have a wrench. The foot rest can swing out and be removed easily and the push handles fold down with the push of a lever. This is a smaller unit which we like for maneuverability, so its probably not suited for large people.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fold and move to a car or truck. Super light weight. Easy to maneuver. I am 6 Ft and 175 lbs and it is perfect for me but for someone who is 2 inches taller or substantially heavier it may not be the best choice. Also, the angle of the leg cannot be changed so it could be a problem for some injuries. I have used it in airport terminals, cars, trucks, stores and banks. Works just fine. Highly recommend it. I also recommend getting a seat cushion as it adds to your comfort in long waits.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bahls

customer_reviews.title: It is not comfortable as a result
customer_reviews.text: It is a light weight wheelchair but the foot pedals are way too high and are not adjustable . I am 5'3" and 135 pounds and my knees sit very high up. It is not comfortable as a result. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dhianna Yezzi

customer_reviews.title: Karman Wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: OK, but have to keep tools with me to tighten nuts on brakes constantly. Also the tires have no grip so wheelchair ramps can be tough, they spin and it aint easy getting up.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Child size wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: I immediately opened the box and pulled out a minature wheelchair. It is sized for a child or someone around 5 feet tall. There is only one adjustment and that would make it even smaller. My feet drag on the ground, but I can barely reach the wheels to maneuver. I am 5'7'' tall and 140 pounds. Trying to return it, unsuccessfully. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Solid unit used about a dozen times. Folds easily for transportation is more stable than the medline transport we replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mattox

customer_reviews.title: Easy, comfortable chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair for my 90 year old mother who had broken her hip. She is 5’5”, 135 lbs., and it fits her well. Ample room in the chair, but It goes thru most doorways in the house and she uses it with ease on carpet and hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Jonell

customer_reviews.title: folds up nicely, transports easily in and out of home
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, folds up nicely, transports easily in and out of home, the trunk of a car, medical offices etc., easy to control, brakes hold tight making the patient safer and more secure moving in and out of the wheelchair. The Duro-Med wheelchair cushion provides more padding and comfort for longer sits and greater travel.
customer_reviews.author: K Proctor

customer_reviews.title: This chair is a back saver and far better than the more expensive one Medicare provided for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is a back saver and far better than the more expensive one Medicare provided for my father which I will be returning to them. Also came with pouch for gait belt which was a very nice surprise. Highly recommend purchasing the "anti-tip" option as this is so light it does go backwards when placing the patient by yourself. My father loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Guru

customer_reviews.title: Even an elderly caregiver can manage this light weight chair!
customer_reviews.text: My 94-yr-old mother has almost completely lost her mobility. She has a power chair she uses in her house but is fearful of ramps and so won't even try to drive the chair down or up one. So, the wheelchair is used to get her to her car and can go along so she has her ability to participate in more activities. The chair will fit in the back seat of her car or in her trunk. It means she can get out of the house again!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Comstock

customer_reviews.title: very light and folds very easy, back folds down and is perfect to throw ...

customer_reviews.author: ASW

customer_reviews.title: Good and solid wheelchair and easy to lift into the ...

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly

The front wheels are a little small which can made it a little tricky to go up over a threshold plate when leaving a sporting event the first time using it. It will go over it with a bit of a run before you hit it.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Needs a cup holder otherwise very sturdy, wheels have support to go over bumps and comfy to sit in.
customer_reviews.author: chackett

customer_reviews.title: A real upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wheelchair, both comfortable and sturdy. While it has a full size seat, it is more maneuverable with a smaller wheelbase. This makes it easier to get through doors and shop in stores. This chair lays flat in my Hyundai trunk and is easy to lift in and out. We have received several complements on this chair too.

customer_reviews.title: Love This chair !!

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy to manipulate light weight and sturdy product

It will improve her mobility and ability to get around in her assisted living facility. Only reason not to give a 5 star are the knobby hand wheels. They make it a bit difficult for her to grasp. A pair of gloves solved that problem. Would recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: for small people

customer_reviews.title: Handy, easy to fold and light
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to fold. The back also folds down which makes getting into car trunk much easier. Foot rests are easy to swing and easy to remove. Has small storage pouch on back. Arrived fully assembled! Just remove some clear wrap and you’re ready to go. The wheels that one uses to propel the chair have a knurled design. I’d prefer smooth but they’re fine. An excellent and light wheelchair
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: I love how light this wheelchair is. I can be independent, which is very important to me, as I am able to hoist it in and out of my SUV by myself and take it in short grass to clean up after my service dog. I am a small woman but do have relatively good muscle strength-I can't speak for others but this works great for me. Exactly what I wanted when I ordered it!
customer_reviews.author: clynh

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely in my very small car.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Folds easily. Not as comfortable as heavier chairs but worth it to gain the easier handling.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the new Karman chair

customer_reviews.title: Great chair.

customer_reviews.title: Great light wheel chair

customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: compact, light weight, right price
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for and a great price too.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have COPD and have not been able to walk very far without getting out of breath. This chair gives me back my independence to go shopping and doctors appointments.

customer_reviews.title: Good product

customer_reviews.author: L. Zavelina

customer_reviews.title: It will save your back

customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.text: I liked the gray tires, the do not mark the carpet like the black ones do. I have found no faults with this chair, it is very well made.

customer_reviews.title: A great lightweight wheelchair

customer_reviews.title: I probably should have ordered a pediatric version. My ...

Also, the chair does not quite go through the bedroom or bathroom doors at her care home. We thought we might be able to remove the outer circle, the black one that users put their hands on to propel themselves ( if they are able). It is not possible to do this. It took these several months to see where we stood with the chair. All that said I do still appreciate how light the chair is for moving.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful light weight wheel chair I have been looking for ...

customer_reviews.title: But - it is lightweight and very easily

customer_reviews.author: HML

customer_reviews.title: It is light in weight and that is the only good thing I have to say about it
customer_reviews.text: It is not made for someone with long legs. If we put the foot pedals low enough for comfort they would hit the ground when going up or down a small incline or decline. I wish we would have known this because it is very uncomfortable. Anyone with long legs should not order this. It is really hard to roll on carpet too. It is light in weight and that is the only good thing I have to say about it. It is really uncomfortable.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: this was a very well built chair and very light weight, just what we wanted.

customer_reviews.text: What a blessing. I can lift it in and out of the trunk by myself. Easy to use.

customer_reviews.text: I've been helping my wheelchair bound friend around for some time now and although I could lift his old chair into my trunk some of his other helpers had difficulty. customer_reviews.text: So guess who is outside picking flowers with her friends? This chair is so easy to move, she is all over the place. customer_reviews.author: YoungNana

customer_reviews.title: This chair is light and easy to load
customer_reviews.text: Update: This chair is light and easy to load. If u don’t read the instructions, don’t complain about it like I did. the foot rests can be adjusted with a 13mm wrench. Seat height adjustment is a joke as it’s only adjustable by one inch. In addition, the tires do not have good traction...try to turn one wheel and it will spin. Otherwise, it works. It’s a good light and cheap wheelchair. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William J.

customer_reviews.title: Rear wheels and grips can be difficult for self-propulsion
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lightweight wheelchair. Very easy to fold and lift into the trunk/hatchback. Two things which are not optimal: 1) Front caster wheels are only 6" x 1" and tend to catch on small surface imperfections. 8"x2" front wheels are a great upgrade - these fit perfectly:  2) Rear wheels, and especially rear wheel grip rings are difficult for self-propulsion. IF occupant is light weight, anti-tip accessory is strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 87 yr old Mom perfectly and my husband doesn’t always have to be there to load it up
customer_reviews.text: After I read all the reviews I ordered this for my mom. At first we thought we couldn’t adjust the footrest length. Then we read in the booklet about the bolts at the bottom of the footrest. My husband needed a large wrench to loosen the bolt, but. Indeed we were able to lower the footrests! Now, it’s perfect! And I can load in in an SUV with my bad back! She loves it❤️
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the heavy chairs
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Great chair for the money. Of course you would prefer not to have to use one, but if you do... this is the way to go. PS if you have questions about the foot rest being too high, check the company website for details on how to adjust the length. I am 6'3" and fits pretty good especially after adjusting the foot rest. Would definitely suggest this chair and seller to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: m meyer

customer_reviews.title: Best lighter weight chair I could find for the money
customer_reviews.text: I just recently became disabled and started searching for my first wheelchair. I didn't realize they were so heavy until looking at a few. We wanted one my wife could load in the back of her SUV by herself and all the ones we looked at were just too heavy for her to manage. This one was the best deal I found and one that she can manage alone. The weight is its best feature.
customer_reviews.author: mushroom

customer_reviews.title: easy to fold & unfold
customer_reviews.text: We just received the Karman LT-980 lightweight chair. So far it is everything we were looking for. Lightweight for travel, easy to fold & unfold. Easy to load & unload in vehicle. Feels solid & sturdy, not flimsy at all. The foot rests are easy to get on & slip off. Does not take up a lot of room for transportation in the vehicle. This chair just made our travel needs much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Superior wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several wheelchairs because of not sturdy for daily active but handi-able, but this Karman light weight but STRONG and wll built chair is fantastic. It was so easy to assemble, which showed me how sturdy the parts were;. And I am amazed that the price was so low for such a quality chair. I can't be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn morris

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done, but not much else.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re wheelchair bound like myself, then you have felt a quality chair I’m hoping. Hold no expectations like that for this wheelchair. It’s uncomfortable, it doesn’t feel sturdy- even after a tune up (which it needs when you first get it), and much like a car, it actually pulls to the left. I mean on flat surfaces. It pulls to the left!!! Purchase in an situation where you need a chair immediately, I suppose?
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the weight
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the weight, look and quality of this product. The recipient likes the grips on the wheels as it is easier for her to grasp. And we love the light weight when it is loaded in the car. Also handy to have the back handles drop down for a compact fit.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was lighter than the one we had and I'm constantly lifting it to put it back of the car. Unfortunately the spoked wheels are quite flimsy and one is now bent and wobbly. Also, it is much more difficult to push when a 200 lb. person is in it than the old Medline chair. I suspect that's because of the treaded tires. The tires make noise whe rolling on carpet. I used it while traveling on vacation for two months and now it's too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: T.N.

customer_reviews.title: It also tips very easily. I wish I had never bought
customer_reviews.text: This chair is heavy and uncomfortable. It also tips very easily. I wish I had never bought it
customer_reviews.author: Bonne-ra Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for our Lincoln cross over vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for our Lincoln cross over vehicle. Lite weight makes it easy for my 82 yr. old husband to get in and out of our vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. I can lift it in and out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. I can lift it in and out of our trunk. And, I am only 4'11"!!!
customer_reviews.author: PennyReader

customer_reviews.title: Getting my Mom out on the town...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 90 year old Mom ho didn’t want to really go out -was worried about walking to far. Now with this light weight chair It folds and fits in trunk or back of SUV with Ease...She now looks forward to going out to dinner, or going out for a roll...love it. Lightweight...perfect..
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: it's not ultra light weight.
customer_reviews.text: although it seemed to be well made, it weighed abut 27 lbs so if ultralight weight is important to you, don't buy it. great thing about amazon, return was easy and they paid for return shipping also.
customer_reviews.author: hilobilly

customer_reviews.title: Some pro and con
customer_reviews.text: A good unit outside but the tread on the wheels really chews up even a low-pile carpet and requires more effort to propel.
customer_reviews.author: Armand De Luca

product_meta.title: Karman 24 pounds LT-980 Ultra Lightweight Wheelchair Black
product_meta.description:
Karman Healthcare continues to innovate and pioneer the ultra lightweight wheelchair category by offering the LT-980 series. At just about 24 pounds without footrest, the LT-980 series continues to push the envelope in design, function, and appeal for non custom, ultra lightweight wheelchairs. Utilizing the lightest, yet strongest aluminum, the LT-980 is equipped with standard features suitable for almost any daily wheelchair user that is looking to save weight, but maintain a certain budget in mind. The foldable, compact frame allows any family member or companion to lift and store the item just about anywhere. Comfort is also considered behind the design by including a padded nylon upholstery which is easy to clean, and maintain. An additional comfort feature includes the padded desk length armpads for ease of use when sitting at a desk, or table. The height adjustable footrest allow for a near perfect fit, for users between five feet, and up to six feet tall. Natural fit handrims which allow for a more contoured feel are also equipped standard, as well as solid, poly urethane 22 inch rear wheels, and 6 inch front casters that allow the chair to be utilized on just about any surface.

Seatbelt included for additional safety
Built in pouch located on back upholstery
Easy to use removable height adjustable footrest
Solid Polyurethane 22 inch rear wheels and 6 inch front casters, Seat width: 18″x 16″
Ultra lightweight design, weighs only 24 pounds without footrest
Adjustable Height Footplates with heel loops. Weight Capacity of 250 lbs
